dta.RoadLink¶

class RoadLink(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label, group)¶

Bases: dta.Link.Link

A RoadLink in a network. Both nodes must be RoadNodes.

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • startNode, endNode are Nodes
  • reverseAttachedId is the id of the reverse link, if attached; pass None if not attached
  • facilityType is a non-negative integer indicating the category of facility such as a freeway, arterial, collector, etc. A lower number indicates a facility of higher priority, that is, higher capacity and speed.
  • length is the link length, in RoadLink.LENGTH_UNITS. Pass None to automatically calculate it.
  • freeflowSpeed is in km/h or mi/h
  • effectiveLengthFactor is applied to the effective length of a vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • responseTimeFactor is the applied to the response time of the vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • numLanes is an integer
  • roundAbout is true/false or 1/0
  • level is an indicator to attribute vertical alignment/elevation. If None passed, will use default.
  • label is a link label. If None passed, will use default.
  • group is an integer that identifies one or more links; groups are used for calculation of approach delay to an intersection. So all vehicles approaching on the links in one group experience the same approach delay. (todo: example of how this should be used?) If -1 is passed, no group will be used.
__init__(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label, group)¶

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • startNode, endNode are Nodes
  • reverseAttachedId is the id of the reverse link, if attached; pass None if not attached
  • facilityType is a non-negative integer indicating the category of facility such as a freeway, arterial, collector, etc. A lower number indicates a facility of higher priority, that is, higher capacity and speed.
  • length is the link length, in RoadLink.LENGTH_UNITS. Pass None to automatically calculate it.
  • freeflowSpeed is in km/h or mi/h
  • effectiveLengthFactor is applied to the effective length of a vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • responseTimeFactor is the applied to the response time of the vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • numLanes is an integer
  • roundAbout is true/false or 1/0
  • level is an indicator to attribute vertical alignment/elevation. If None passed, will use default.
  • label is a link label. If None passed, will use default.
  • group is an integer that identifies one or more links; groups are used for calculation of approach delay to an intersection. So all vehicles approaching on the links in one group experience the same approach delay. (todo: example of how this should be used?) If -1 is passed, no group will be used.

Attributes

DEFAULT_LABEL str(object) -> string
DEFAULT_LANE_WIDTH int(x[, base]) -> integer
DEFAULT_LEVEL int(x[, base]) -> integer
DIR_EB str(object) -> string
DIR_NB str(object) -> string
DIR_SB str(object) -> string
DIR_WB str(object) -> string
LENGTH_UNITS
DEFAULT_LABEL = ''¶
DEFAULT_LANE_WIDTH = 12¶

default lane width in Node.COORDINATE_UNITS

DEFAULT_LEVEL = 0¶

default level value

DIR_EB = 'EB'¶

Eastbound return value for RoadLink.getDirection()

DIR_NB = 'NB'¶

Northbound return value for RoadLink.getDirection()

DIR_SB = 'SB'¶

Southbound return value for RoadLink.getDirection()

DIR_WB = 'WB'¶

Westbound return value for RoadLink.getDirection()

LENGTH_UNITS = None¶

Static variable representing the units of the length variable Should be kilometers or miles

_checkInputTimeStep(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Checks if the difference of the input times is equal to the simulation time step

_checkOutputTimeStep(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Check that the difference of the input times is in multiples of the simulation time step

_hasMovementVolumes(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return True if at least one movement has a volume greater than 0

_removeOutgoingMovement(movementToRemove)¶

Delete the input movement

_validateInputTimes(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Checks that the input times belong to the simulation window

addLanePermission(laneId, vehicleClassGroup)¶

Adds the lane permissions for the lane numbered by laneId (outside lane is lane 0, increases towards inside edge.)

addOutgoingMovement(movement)¶

Adds the given movement.

addShapePoint(x, y)¶

Append a shape point to the link. Shape points are not actual nodes, but additional coordinates that inform the geometry of a link, such as showing curvature.

addShifts(startShift, endShift, addShapepoints=False)¶

Adds a shift to the start and/or end of the roadlink, to change the alignment of either end by one (or more) lane(s).

Parameters:
  • startShift – the shift value of the first segment of the link, that is, the number of lanes from the center line of the roadway that the first segment is shifted.
  • endShift – End-shift: the shift value of the last segment of the link, that is, the number of lanes from the center line of the roadway that the last segment is shifted.

Dynameq software requires the link to have at least 2 shape points in order to use these shifts. Thus, this method will also add the required shape points, if they’re lacking (just a linear interpolation 1/3 and 2/3 along the line via RoadLink.coordinatesAlongLink() if addShapepoints is True.

allowsAll()¶

Is there a lane on this link that allows all?

coordinatesAlongLink(fromStart, distance, goPastEnd=False)¶

Like RoadLink.coordinatesAndShapePointIdxAlongLink() but only returns the coordinates 2-tuple (x,*y*). For backwards compatibility.

coordinatesAndShapePointIdxAlongLink(fromStart, distance, goPastEnd=False)¶

Returns the 3-tuple (x,*y*,*idx*) where (x,*y*) is the point along this link given by distance, which is in Node.COORDINATE_UNITS. idx is the index into the point array (including the start point, intermediate shape points, and end point) where the (x,*y*) was ultimately found (useful for splitting links and allocating the shape points).

If fromStart, starts at start, otherwise at end.

Takes shape points into account.

If distance is longer than the euclidean distance of the link, and not goPastEnd raises a DtaError.

createReverseLink(newid)¶

Instantiate and return a new link that is the reverse of this one.

disallowSplitForConnector(disallowConnectorEvalStr)¶

Returns True if this road link should not be split for a Connector.

Used by RoadNode.getCandidateLinksForSplitting(), which is used by Network.moveCentroidConnectorsFromIntersectionsToMidblocks().

Basically this DTA Anyway user defines this functionality by passing in disallowConnectorEvalStr.

euclideanLength(includeShape=False)¶

Calculates the length based on simple Euclidean distance.

If this link has shape points and includeShape is True, then the shape is taken into account.

This will be in the units specified by Node.COORDINATE_UNITS.

euclideanLengthInLengthUnits(includeShape=False)¶

Return the length of the link in RoadLink.LENGTH_UNITS units.

findOutgoingMovement(nodeId)¶

Returns the outgoing movement ending in the given nodeId.

If None found, returns None.

getAngle(other, usingShapepoints=False)¶

Return the angle in degrees (in the range (-180, 180]) between this link and other, an instance of Link (where positive angles means the other is clockwise from this, and negative angles means the other is counter-clockwise from self.)

If usingShapepoints, links must have a node in common, and the section of the link involving that common node is examined.

If usingShapepoints is False, both links are considered as vectors from the start node to end node.

getCenterLine(atStart=False, atEnd=False, wholeLineShapePoints=False)¶

Offset the link to the right 0.5*numLanes*:py:attr:RoadLink.DEFAULT_LANE_WIDTH and return a tuple of two points (each one being a tuple of two floats) representing the centerline

If atStart is True, then shapepoints are included and the first section of the line is used. If atEnd is True, then shapepoints are included and the last section of the line is used.

If neither is True, then shapepoints are included iff wholeLineShapePoints (and a list is returned rather than a tuple of two points).

getDirection(atEnd=True)¶

Returns the direction of the link as one of RoadLink.DIR_EB, RoadLink.DIR_NB, RoadLink.DIR_WB or RoadLink.DIR_SB. Uses getOrientation() so the shape points are used with the atEnd argument.

getDistanceFromPoint(x, y)¶

Projects (x, y) onto the road link center line (including the shape points). Returns (distance, t) where t is in [0,1] and indicates how far between the road links start point and end point lies the closest point to (x, y).

x,*y* are in Node.COORDINATE_UNITS

getEndNode()¶

Accessor for endNode

getEndNodeId()¶

Return the id of the end node

getFacilityType()¶

Returns the facility type; see RoadLink.__init__() for more on that variable.

getFreeFlowSpeedInMPH()¶

Return the free flow speed in MPH

getFreeFlowTTInMin()¶

Return the free flow travel time in minutes

getGroup()¶

Return the group number for the link

getId()¶

Return the link id

getIid()¶

Return a pair representing the start and end node ids

getLabel()¶

Return the link label

getLanePermission(laneId)¶

Accessor for the VehicleClassGroup that uses the given lane.

Returns None if nothing is set.

getLeftTurn()¶

Return the left turn movement of the link or raise an error if it does not exist

getLength()¶

Return the length of the link in RoadLink.LENGTH_UNITS units.

Uses the user input length, if there is one; otherwise calculates the euclidean length including the shape.

getLengthInCoordinateUnits()¶

Returns the length of the link in Node.COORDINATE_UNITS units.

Uses the asserted length, if there is one; otherwise calculates the euclidean length.

getMidPoint()¶

Return the midpoint of the link’s centerline as a tuple of two floats

This uses RoadLink.coordinatesAlongLink() and includes shapepoints.

getNumIncomingMovements()¶

Returns the number of incoming movements

getNumLanes()¶

Return the number of lanes.

getNumOutgoingMovements()¶

Returns the number of outgoing movements

getNumShapePoints()¶

Return the number of shape points this link has

getObsCount(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return the number of vehicles traversing the link in the input time window.

getObsMeanTT(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Get the observed mean travel time of the link in minutes

getObsSpeedInMPH(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Get the observed speed of specified time period

getOrientation(atEnd=True, usingShapepoints=True)¶

Returns the angle of the link in degrees from the North measured clockwise. The result is in [0, 360)

The link shape is taken into account if usingShapepoints is True.

If there are shape points, and atEnd is True, then the orientation is evaluated at the end point of the link, otherwise it’s evaluated at the start of the link.

getOtherEnd(node)¶

Return the other end node than the one provided.

getOutgoingMovement(nodeId)¶

Returns the outgoing movement with an end node specified by the given nodeId (and this link as the incoming link).

getOutgoingMovementForLinkId(linkId)¶

Returns the outgoing movement with the outgoing link specified by the given linkId (and this link as the incoming link).

getOutline(scale=1)¶

Return the outline of the link as a linearRing of points in clockwise order. If scale the physical outline of the link will be return using the number of lanes attribute to determine the boundaries of the outline.

getReferenceAngle()¶

Visualizing the link as a straight vector from (0,0), returns the angle between <1,0> and this link.

So returns a number in [0,2pi), increasing clockwise.

These are based on the euclidean length of the link, so assumes a straight line. If the link has no length, returns 0.

getReferenceAngleInDegrees()¶

Return the Reference angle in degrees

getRightTurn()¶

Return the thru movement of the link or raise an error if it does not exist

getShapePoints()¶

Accessor for the shape points.

getShifts()¶

Returns the startShift and endShift ordered pair, or (None,None) if it wasn’t set. See addShifts() for details.

getSimInFlow(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Get the simulated incoming flow in vph

getSimInVolume(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return the incoming volume on the link from startTimeInMin to endTimeInMin

getSimOutFlow(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Get the simulated flow in vph

getSimOutVolume(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return the volume on the link from startTimeInMin to endTimeInMin

getSimSpeedInMPH(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶
getSimTTInMin(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Get the average travel time of the vehicles traversing the link

getStartNode()¶

Accessor for startNode

getStartNodeId()¶

Return the id of the start node

getSumOfAllMovementCounts(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return the sum of all outgoing movement counts

getThruTurn()¶

Return the thru movement of the link or raise an error if it does not exist

getTollLink()¶

Return the tollLink value for the link

hasAllMovementCounts(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return True if there is a count for all outgoing movements in the input time period

hasCountInfo()¶

Return True if the link contains count information else false

hasDirection(dir, atEnd=True)¶

Returns True if the link is going in that direction at all. That is, if a link is oriented to the southwest, this will return True for dir RoadLink.DIR_SB and dir RoadLink.DIR_WB but False otherwise. atEnd is interpreted by the getOrientation() method.

hasLeftTurn()¶

Return True if the link has a through turn

hasMovementCountInfo()¶

Return True if any outgoing movement on the link contains count information else false

hasObsCount(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin)¶

Return True if there is a count for the input time period

hasOutgoingMovement(nodeId, vehicleClassGroup=None)¶

Return True if the link has an outgoing movement towards nodeId. Please note that the movement may be prohibited.

hasRightTurn()¶

Return True if the link has a through turn

hasSameAttributes(other)¶

Return True if the two links have the same attributes return True

hasThruTurn()¶

Return True if the link has a through turn

isConnector()¶

Return True if this Link is a Connector

isOverlapping(other, usingShapepoints=False)¶

Return True if the given link and other overlap. Assumes they share an endpoint. See RoadLink.getAngle() for explanation of usingShapePoints.

isRoadLink()¶

Return True this Link is RoadLink

isVirtualLink()¶

Return True if this LInk is a VirtualLink

iterIncidentMovements()¶

Return an iterator to all the incident movemements of this link

iterIncomingMovements()¶

Iterator for the incoming movements of this link

iterOutgoingMovements()¶

Iterator for the outgoing movements of this link

prohibitOutgoingMovement(movementToProhibit)¶

Prohibit the input movement

setGroup(group)¶

Set the group number for the link

setLabel(label)¶

Set the link label

setLength(newLength)¶

Sets the asserted length of this link; the newLength should be in units specified by RoadLink.LENGTH_UNITS

setNumLanes(numLanes)¶

Sets the number of lanes to the given value

setObsCount(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin, count)¶

Set the number of vehicles Traversing the link in the input time period

setResTimeFac(newResFac)¶

Sets the response time factor to the given value

setSimOutVolume(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin, volume)¶

Set the simulated volume on the edge provided that the edge does not have any emanating movements

setSimTTInMin(startTimeInMin, endTimeInMin, averageTTInMin)¶

Set the simulated travel time on the link for the particular input period

setTollLink(newTollLink)¶

Sets the tollLink field (dummy var indicating tolled link) to specified value (should be zero or one)
